newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan to tender for 50,000 tonnes sugar.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan to tender for 50,000 tonnes sugar.

text.p: The state-run Trading Corporation of Pakistan (TCP) said on Wednesday the Commerce Ministry had instructed it to tender for 50,000 tonnes of crystal white refined sugar for delivery by end-June or early July.
"We will issue the tender this week or early next week," a TCP official told Reuters.
He said 50,000 tonnes of sugar would be imported in cargoes of 12,500 tonnes each for shipment by end-June or early July.

"We have set a late shipment date to allow more suppliers to participate in the tender," he said. "We are not sure about the price but according to our information we can get an advantage of about $10 to $15 per tonne for July shipment."
In January the TCP imported 25,000 tonnes of sugar from the Indian Sugar General Imports & Export Corporation and another 35,000 tonnes from the State Trading Corporation of India.
Private traders have also booked orders for the import of 150,000 tonnes this year.
Local sugar output had reached 1.675 million tonnes by February 28, against 1.966 million in the year-ago period.
The Pakistan Sugar Mills Association said sugar production was likely to be around 2.65 million tonnes in 1996/97 (July-June) compared to 2.47 million in 1995/97 and three million in 1994/95.
